title.value: A Reproducible and Realistic Evaluation of Partial Domain Adaptation Methods
title.justification: Paper title is 'A Reproducible and Realistic Evaluation of Partial Domain Adaptation Methods'
title.quote: A R EPRODUCIBLE AND R EALISTIC E VALUATION OF PARTIAL D OMAIN A DAPTATION M ETHODS

extractions.description: This paper evaluates various Partial Domain Adaptation (PDA) methods for unsupervised domain adaptation, assessing how they perform under different model selection strategies without target labels. The authors also emphasize the need for a consistent assessment protocol and open-source their framework, BenchmarkPDA.

type.justification: The study provides experimental evaluation and comparison of different PDA methods on various datasets. It focuses on empirical evidence to support its conclusions.
type.quote: The main goal of this work is to provide a realistic evaluation of PDA methods with the different model selection strategies under a consistent evaluation protocol. We evaluate 7 representative PDA algorithms on 2 different real-world datasets using 7 different model selection strategies.

name.justification: The paper focuses on domain adaptation within the context of image recognition tasks.
name.quote: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation (UDA) aims at classifying unlabeled target images leveraging source labeled ones.

name.justification: The paper centers on domain adaptation, particularly Partial Domain Adaptation (PDA).
name.quote: In this paper, we consider a more challenging variant of the problem called partial domain adaptation (PDA): the classes in the target domain Yt form a subset of the classes in the source domain Ys (Cao et al., 2018), i.e., Yt âŠ‚ Ys.

name.justification: The paper involves unsupervised learning as it aims to classify unlabeled target images using labeled source images.
name.quote: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation (UDA) aims at classifying unlabeled target images leveraging source labeled ones.

name.quote: We evaluate 7 representative PDA algorithms on 2 different real-world datasets using 7 different model selection strategies.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The method is detailed in another paper titled 'Partial Adversarial Domain Adaptation'.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Cao et al. (2018) proposed PADA that introduces a PDA specific solution to adversarial domain adaptation.

referenced_paper_title.value: Larger Norm More Transferable: An Adaptive Feature Norm Approach for Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
referenced_paper_title.justification: The method is detailed in another paper titled 'Larger Norm More Transferable: An Adaptive Feature Norm Approach for Unsupervised Domain Adaptation'.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Xu et al. (2019) empirically found than target samples have low feature norm compared to source samples.... They proposed SAFN which progressively adapts the feature norms of the two domains by minimizing the Maximum Mean Feature Norm Discrepancy.

referenced_paper_title.quote: Jian et al. (2020) proposed BA 3 US which augments the target mini-batch with source samples to transform the PDA problem in a vanilla DA problem.
